instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B running slow
threads.message:
Hi!

I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B logic board, the cpu is running @800Mhz and fan spinning high.
Checked the board and found <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> burnt/oxydated 
Replaced it but same problems, and AHT gives me that errors:

PFM006 (issue with SMC)
PPN001 (issue with the power management system)
NDC001 (issue with the camera)

What you suggest to do?

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B running slow
threads.message:
"NDC001 (issue with the camera)"
That means ALS (Ambient Light Sensor) issue.
So clean camera connector and check its solders/traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B running slow
threads.message:
already checked camera connector and it's nice and clean!
Tomorrow i'm gonna check camera cable
(a camera problem can be connected to smc/pw management problem in your opinion?)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B running slow
threads.message:
ALS and Finstack Temp Sensor share the same bus through LIO connector.
You may have other issue with Power Management V/I sensor.
Check LIO connector and flex.
Also try other LIO board/flex.
